section.name: s2
section.heading: Interpretation
section.def: applicable fee (適用費用), in relation to a matter, means the fee specified in Schedule 3 payable for that matter; (12 of 2023 s. 24)
care and attention home (高度照顧安老院) means a residential care home within the meaning of section 3(a); (12 of 2023 s. 24)
care staff (護理人員) includes a care worker, health worker and nurse but does not include a home manager or nurse-in-charge; (34 of 2018 s. 145)
enrolled nurse (登記護士) means a person with full enrolment or limited enrolment within the meaning of the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164); (34 of 2018 s. 145; 24 of 2024 s. 93)
health worker (保健員) means a person who is responsible for providing health and care services to residents of a residential care home; (12 of 2023 s. 24)
home manager (主管) means any person responsible for the management of a residential care home;

nurse-in-charge (主管護士), in relation to a nursing home, means any person who is a registered nurse and who is responsible for supervising the nursing care of the residents in the nursing home; (34 of 2018 s. 145)
particulars of identity (身分詳情) means the particulars set out on an identity card issued under the Registration of Persons Ordinance (Cap. 177); (14 of 2008 s. 18)

pre-material-date home manager (關鍵日期前的主管) means a person who was employed as a home manager in a residential care home or a residential care home for PWDs immediately before the material date; (12 of 2023 s. 24)
register of health workers (保健員註冊紀錄冊) means the register kept under section 5(1); (12 of 2023 s. 24)
register of home managers (主管註冊紀錄冊) means the register kept under section 3X(1); (12 of 2023 s. 24)
registered health worker (註冊保健員) means a person whose name appears on the register of health workers; (12 of 2023 s. 24)

registered home manager (provisional) (註冊主管(臨時)) means a person whose name appears on the list of persons registered as registered home managers (provisional) in the register of home managers; (12 of 2023 s. 24)
registered nurse (註冊護士) means a person with full registration or limited registration within the meaning of the Nurses Registration Ordinance (Cap. 164); (34 of 2018 s. 145; 24 of 2024 s. 93)
scheduled infectious disease (表列傳染病) has the same meaning as in the Prevention and Control of Disease Ordinance (Cap. 599); (14 of 2008 s. 18; 12 of 2023 s. 24)
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Labour and Welfare; (12 of 2023 s. 24)
self-care hostel (低度照顧安老院) means a residential care home within the meaning of section 3(c). (12 of 2023 s. 24)

section.name: s3
section.heading: Types of residential care homes
section.leadIn: For the purposes of section 8(4)(c) of the Ordinance and this Regulation, a residential care home may be classified as— (12 of 2023 s. 25)

paragraph.name: aa
paragraph.def: a nursing home (護養院) namely, an establishment providing residential care, supervision and guidance for persons who have attained the age of 60 years, and who are suffering from a functional disability to the extent that they require personal care and attention in the course of daily living activities, and a high degree of professional nursing care, but do not require continuous medical supervision; or (34 of 2018 s. 146)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.def: a care and attention home (高度照顧安老院) namely, an establishment providing residential care, supervision and guidance for persons who have attained the age of 60 years and who are generally weak in health and are suffering from a functional disability to the extent that they require personal care and attention in the course of daily living activities but do not require a high degree of professional medical or nursing care; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.def: an aged home (中度照顧安老院) namely, an establishment providing residential care, supervision and guidance for persons who have attained the age of 60 years and who are capable of observing personal hygiene but have a degree of difficulty in performing household duties related to cleaning, cooking, laundering, shopping and other domestic tasks; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.def: a self-care hostel (低度照顧安老院) namely, an establishment providing residential care, supervision and guidance for persons who have attained the age of 60 years and who are capable of observing personal hygiene and performing household duties related to cleaning, cooking, laundering, shopping and other domestic tasks.

section.name: s3A
section.heading: Application for registration as registered home manager

subsection.leadIn: An application for registration as a registered home manager must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On the application, the Director may register the applicant as a registered home manager if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the applicant—

subparagraph.content: meets the qualification requirement specified in section 3B;
is competent to perform the duties of a home manager; and
is fit and proper to be so registered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the applicable fee for the registration.

subsection.content: The Director may impose on the registration any condition that the Director considers appropriate, including any condition relating to continuous learning.

section.name: s3B
section.heading: Qualification requirement for registration as registered home manager

subsection.leadIn: For section 3A(2)(a)(i), the qualification requirement is that—

subparagraph.content: is one specified in subsection (2)(a), (b), (c) or (d); and
has completed a training course specified by the Director; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a registered home manager as defined by section 2 of Cap. 613A.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified for subsection (1)(a)(i)—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: a professional qualification relating to healthcare or social work specified by the Director; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: a bachelor or higher degree, or an academic qualification regarded by the Director as equivalent; and

has, within 3 years before making the application, worked in one or more residential care homes or residential care homes for PWDs for a total of at least 1 year in a position involving or assisting in the management of the residential care homes or residential care homes for PWDs;
is a registered health worker within the meaning of this Regulation, or a registered health worker as defined by section 2 of Cap. 613A; and
has worked in one or more residential care homes or residential care homes for PWDs as a health worker for a total of at least 5 years;

paragraph.name: c
d
paragraph.leadIn: a pre-material-date home manager who is—

subparagraph.content: a registered home manager (provisional) within the meaning of this Regulation; or
a registered home manager (provisional) as defined by section 2 of Cap. 613A.

section.name: s3C
section.heading: Fit and proper requirement for registration as registered home manager
section.leadIn: For section 3A(2)(a)(iii), in considering whether a person is fit and proper to be registered as a registered home manager, the Director must have regard to all relevant matters, including—

subparagraph.content: convicted of an offence involving fraud or dishonesty, or of a sexual nature, in any place;
convicted of an indictable offence in Hong Kong;
sentenced to imprisonment (however described) in a place outside Hong Kong, whether or not the sentence is suspended; or
convicted of an offence under the Ordinance, this Regulation, Cap. 613 or Cap. 613A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if any professional or academic qualification of the person (whether or not relating to healthcare or social work) has been revoked—the reason for the revocation.

section.name: s3D
section.heading: Notice of decision on application for registration

subsection.content: On determining an application under section 3A, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to the applicant.
If the application is approved, the notice must state the validity period of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant may appeal under section 3K.

section.name: s3E
section.heading: Renewal of registration as registered home manager

subsection.content: A registered home manager may apply for the renewal of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director at least 3 months before, but not earlier than 6 months before, the expiry of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On the application, the Director may renew the registration if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the registered home manager—

subparagraph.content: still meets the requirements for registration under section 3A(2)(a)(ii) and (iii); and
complies with all conditions imposed on the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the manager has paid the applicable fee for the renewal.

subsection.content: The Director may impose on the renewed registration any condition that the Director considers appropriate, including any condition relating to continuous learning.

section.name: s3F
section.heading: Notice of decision on application for renewal of registration

subsection.content: On determining an application under section 3E, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to the applicant.
If the application is approved, the notice must state the validity period of the renewed registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant may appeal under section 3K.

section.name: s3G
section.heading: Registration remains in effect pending determination of renewal application

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered home manager applies for the renewal of the registration under section 3E; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration would, but for this section, have expired before the application is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The registration remains in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director determines the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered home manager withdraws the application.

section.name: s3H
section.heading: Validity period of registration as registered home manager
section.content: The validity period of a registration or renewed registration as a registered home manager is to be decided by the Director and must not exceed 5 years.

section.name: s3I
section.heading: Cancellation of registration as registered home manager

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel a person’s registration as a registered home manager if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration was obtained by fraudulent means;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person no longer meets the requirement for registration under section 3A(2)(a)(ii) or (iii); or

subparagraph.content: a condition imposed on the registration under section 3A(3) or 3E(4); or
section 3W.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must cancel a person’s registration as a registered home manager—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person makes a written request to the Director for cancelling the registration; or

subparagraph.content: the person was also registered as a registered home manager or registered home manager (provisional) under Cap. 613A; and
that registration under Cap. 613A is cancelled under section 3I(1)(a) or (b) or 3T(1)(a) or (b) of Cap. 613A.

subsection.leadIn: The cancellation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (1)—subject to section 3K(3), on the expiry of 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice under section 3J; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (2)—on the expiry of 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice under section 3J.

section.name: s3J
section.heading: Notice of cancellation of registration

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 3I, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is employed in a residential care home when the decision is made—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation takes effect under section 3I(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reason for cancelling the registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled under section 3I(1)—that the person may appeal under section 3K.

section.name: s3K
section.heading: Appeals to Secretary

subsection.leadIn: If the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decides to refuse to register a person under section 3A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decides to refuse to renew a person’s registration under section 3E; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 3I(1),

subsection.continued: the person may, by written notice, appeal to the Secretary against the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds of appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Director within 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice of the decision.

subsection.content: If an appeal is made against a decision described in subsection (1)(c), the decision does not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: When considering an appeal against a decision of the Director, the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give the appellant and the Director an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may confirm, vary or reverse the decision and, if the decision is reversed, substitute for the decision a decision that the Secretary considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Secretary varies, or substitutes another decision for, the Director’s decision, the decision as varied or the substituted decision must be one that the Director had power to make.

subsection.leadIn: On the determination of the appeal by the Secretary, the Director must give a written notice of the determination to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the appellant is employed in a residential care home when the appeal is determined—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home.

subsection.content: The notice referred to in subsection (6) must state the reason for the determination.

section.name: s3L
section.heading: Registration remains in effect pending determination of appeal

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person appeals against a decision described in section 3K(1)(b) or (c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s registration as a registered home manager would, but for this section, have expired before the appeal is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The registration remains in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary determines the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person withdraws the appeal.

section.name: s3M
section.heading: Application for registration as registered home manager (provisional)

subsection.leadIn: An application for registration as a registered home manager (provisional) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On the application, the Director may register the applicant as a registered home manager (provisional) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the applicant—

subparagraph.content: meets the qualification requirement specified in section 3N;
is competent to perform the duties of a home manager;
is fit and proper to be so registered; and
if the applicant is not a pre-material-date home manager—on being so registered, will be employed as a home manager in a residential care home under section 11(1)(a) or (1A)(a); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the applicable fee for the registration.

subsection.content: The Director may impose on the registration any condition that the Director considers appropriate, including any condition relating to continuous learning.

section.name: s3N
section.heading: Qualification requirement for registration as registered home manager (provisional)
section.leadIn: For section 3M(2)(a)(i), the qualification requirement is that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: holds a professional qualification relating to healthcare or social work specified by the Director;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: holds a bachelor or higher degree, or an academic qualification regarded by the Director as equivalent; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is a pre-material-date home manager who applies for registration as a registered home manager (provisional) under section 3M during the 6-month period beginning on the material date.

section.name: s3O
section.heading: Fit and proper requirement for registration as registered home manager (provisional)
section.content: For section 3M(2)(a)(iii), in considering whether a person is fit and proper to be registered as a registered home manager (provisional), the Director must have regard to all relevant matters, including the matters mentioned in section 3C(a) and (b).

section.name: s3P
section.heading: Notice of decision on application for registration

subsection.content: On determining an application under section 3M, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to the applicant.
If the application is approved, the notice must state the validity period of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant may appeal under section 3V.

section.name: s3Q
section.heading: Validity period of registration as registered home manager (provisional)
section.content: The validity period of a registration as a registered home manager (provisional) is to be decided by the Director and must not exceed 2 years.

section.name: s3R
section.heading: Extension of validity period

subsection.content: A person who is registered as a registered home manager (provisional) because of meeting the qualification requirement specified in section 3N(c) may apply for the extension of the validity period of the registration once.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director before the expiry of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.content: The Director may extend the validity period of the registration for a period of not more than 2 years only if satisfied that there are exceptional circumstances that justify the extension.

section.name: s3S
section.heading: Registration remains in effect pending determination of certain application

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

subparagraph.content: for registration under section 3A; or
for the extension of the validity period of the registration under section 3R; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration would, but for this section, have expired before the application is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The registration remains in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director determines the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered home manager (provisional) withdraws the application.

section.name: s3T
section.heading: Cancellation of registration as registered home manager (provisional)

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel a person’s registration as a registered home manager (provisional) if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration was obtained by fraudulent means;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person no longer meets the requirement for registration under section 3M(2)(a)(ii) or (iii); or

subparagraph.content: a condition imposed on the registration under section 3M(3); or
section 3W.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must cancel a person’s registration as a registered home manager (provisional)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is registered as a registered home manager under section 3A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person makes a written request to the Director for cancelling the registration; or

subparagraph.content: the person was also registered as a registered home manager or registered home manager (provisional) under Cap. 613A; and
that registration under Cap. 613A is cancelled under section 3I(1)(a) or (b) or 3T(1)(a) or (b) of Cap. 613A.

subsection.leadIn: The cancellation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (2)(a)—on the day on which the registration under section 3A takes effect; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (2)(b) or (c)—on the expiry of 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice under section 3U.

section.name: s3U
section.heading: Notice of cancellation of registration

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 3T, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is employed in a residential care home when the decision is made—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation takes effect under section 3T(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reason for cancelling the registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled under section 3T(1)—that the person may appeal under section 3V.

section.name: s3V
section.heading: Appeals to Secretary

subsection.leadIn: If the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decides to refuse to register a person under section 3M; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 3T(1),

subsection.continued: the person may, by written notice, appeal to the Secretary against the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds of appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Director within 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice of the decision.

subsection.content: If an appeal is made against a decision described in subsection (1)(b), the decision does not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: When considering an appeal against a decision of the Director, the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give the appellant and the Director an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may confirm, vary or reverse the decision and, if the decision is reversed, substitute for the decision a decision that the Secretary considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Secretary varies, or substitutes another decision for, the Director’s decision, the decision as varied or the substituted decision must be one that the Director had power to make.

subsection.leadIn: On the determination of the appeal by the Secretary, the Director must give a written notice of the determination to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the appellant is employed in a residential care home when the appeal is determined—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home.

subsection.content: The notice referred to in subsection (6) must state the reason for the determination.

section.name: s3W
section.heading: Registered home manager or registered home manager (provisional) to report certain events

subsection.leadIn: A registered home manager or a registered home manager (provisional) must report to the Director if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prosecution is started against the manager for an indictable offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prosecution is started against the manager for an offence punishable with imprisonment (however described) in a place outside Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the manager is convicted of an indictable offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the manager is sentenced to imprisonment (however described) in a place outside Hong Kong, whether or not the sentence is suspended;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any professional or academic qualification of the manager (whether or not relating to healthcare or social work) is revoked; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: there is a change in the name or correspondence address of the manager.

subsection.leadIn: The report must—

subparagraph.content: for a change described in subsection (1)(f)—within 3 months after the change occurs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

section.name: s3X
section.heading: Register of home managers

subsection.leadIn: The Director must keep a register containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a list of persons registered as registered home managers under Division 1; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a list of persons registered as registered home managers (provisional) under Division 2.

subsection.leadIn: The purpose of the register is to enable the public to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a person is a registered home manager or registered home manager (provisional); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: Each list in the register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain the name and correspondence address of each person on the list; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain other particulars that the Director considers appropriate.

subsection.content: The Director may make any amendment to the register that the Director considers necessary for securing its accuracy or keeping it up-to-date.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must remove from the register the name of a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has come to the notice of the Director that the person has died; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s registration ceases to have effect on expiry or cancellation.

section.name: s3Y
section.heading: Inspection of register of home managers
section.leadIn: The Director must make the register of home managers available for public inspection—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: free of charge;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at offices of the Government that the Director directs; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: during the hours when those offices are open to the public.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Qualifications for registration as registered health worker

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has completed a course of training approved by the Director in writing either generally or in any particular case; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by reason of the person’s education, training, professional experience and skill in health work, satisfies the Director that the person is a suitable person to be registered as a registered health worker,

section.continued: is qualified to be registered as a registered health worker for the purposes of employment at a residential care home.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Register of health workers

subsection.content: The Director must keep a register containing a list of persons registered as registered health workers under this Part. (12 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The purpose of the register is to enable the public to ascertain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether a person is a registered health worker; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars of the registration. (12 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: The register—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must contain the name and correspondence address of each person in the register; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may contain other particulars that the Director considers appropriate. (12 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.content: The register must be available for inspection by the public free of charge at such offices of the Government as the Director may direct, during the hours when those offices are open to the public. (12 of 2023 s. 28)
The Director may make any amendment to the register that the Director considers necessary for securing its accuracy or keeping it up-to-date. (12 of 2023 s. 28)

subsection.leadIn: The Director must remove from the register the name of a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has come to the notice of the Director that the person has died; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s registration ceases to have effect on expiry or cancellation. (12 of 2023 s. 28)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Application for registration as registered health worker

subsection.leadIn: An application for registration as a registered health worker must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On the application, the Director may register the applicant as a registered health worker if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the applicant—

subparagraph.content: is qualified under section 4 to be so registered;
is competent to perform the duties of a health worker; and
is fit and proper to be so registered; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant has paid the applicable fee for the registration.

subsection.content: The Director may impose on the registration any condition that the Director considers appropriate, including any condition relating to continuous learning.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Notice of decision on application for registration

subsection.content: On determining an application under section 6, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to the applicant.
If the application is approved, the notice must state the validity period of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant may appeal under section 10.

section.name: s7A
section.heading: Renewal of registration as registered health worker

subsection.content: A registered health worker may apply for the renewal of the registration.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made to the Director at least 3 months before, but not earlier than 6 months before, the expiry of the registration;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be made in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: On the application, the Director may renew the registration if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the Director is satisfied that the registered health worker—

subparagraph.content: still meets the requirements for registration under section 6(2)(a); and
complies with all conditions imposed on the registration; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the health worker has paid the applicable fee for the renewal.

subsection.content: The Director may impose on the renewed registration any condition that the Director considers appropriate, including any condition relating to continuous learning.

section.name: s7B
section.heading: Notice of decision on application for renewal of registration

subsection.content: On determining an application under section 7A, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to the applicant.
If the application is approved, the notice must state the validity period of the renewed registration.

subsection.leadIn: If the application is refused, the notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the reason for the refusal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the applicant may appeal under section 10.

section.name: s7C
section.heading: Registration remains in effect pending determination of renewal application

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a registered health worker applies for the renewal of the registration under section 7A; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registration would, but for this section, have expired before the application is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The registration remains in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Director determines the application; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the registered health worker withdraws the application.

section.name: s7D
section.heading: Validity period of registration as registered health worker
section.content: The validity period of a registration or renewed registration as a registered health worker is to be decided by the Director and must not exceed 5 years.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Cancellation of registration as registered health worker

subsection.leadIn: The Director may cancel a person’s registration as a registered health worker if satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the registration was obtained by fraudulent means;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person no longer meets the requirement for registration under section 6(2)(a)(i), (ii) or (iii); or

subparagraph.content: a condition imposed on the registration under section 6(3) or 7A(4); or
section 10B.

subsection.leadIn: The Director must cancel a person’s registration as a registered health worker—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person makes a written request to the Director for cancelling the registration; or

subparagraph.content: the person was also registered as a registered health worker under Cap. 613A; and
that registration under Cap. 613A is cancelled under section 8(1)(a) or (b) of Cap. 613A.

subsection.leadIn: The cancellation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (1)—subject to section 10(3), on the expiry of 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice under section 9; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a cancellation under subsection (2)—on the expiry of 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice under section 9.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Notice of cancellation of registration

subsection.leadIn: If the Director decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 8, the Director must give a written notice of the decision to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is employed in a residential care home when the decision is made—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home. (12 of 2023 s. 33)

subsection.leadIn: The notice must state—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the date on which the cancellation takes effect under section 8(3);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reason for cancelling the registration; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the registration is cancelled under section 8(1)—that the person may appeal under section 10. (12 of 2023 s. 33)

section.name: s10
section.heading: Appeals to Secretary

subsection.leadIn: If the Director—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: decides to refuse to register a person under section 6;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: decides to refuse to renew a person’s registration under section 7A; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: decides to cancel a person’s registration under section 8(1),

subsection.continued: the person may, by written notice, appeal to the Secretary against the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: state the grounds of appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be delivered to the Director within 21 days after the day on which the Director gives the notice of the decision.

subsection.content: If an appeal is made against a decision described in subsection (1)(c), the decision does not have effect pending the determination of the appeal by the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: When considering an appeal against a decision of the Director, the Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must give the appellant and the Director an opportunity of being heard; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may confirm, vary or reverse the decision and, if the decision is reversed, substitute for the decision a decision that the Secretary considers appropriate.

subsection.content: If the Secretary varies, or substitutes another decision for, the Director’s decision, the decision as varied or the substituted decision must be one that the Director had power to make.

subsection.leadIn: On the determination of the appeal by the Secretary, the Director must give a written notice of the determination to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the appellant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the appellant is employed in a residential care home when the appeal is determined—the operator and the responsible person of the residential care home.

subsection.content: The notice referred to in subsection (6) must state the reason for the determination.

section.name: s10A
section.heading: Registration remains in effect pending determination of appeal

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person appeals against a decision described in section 10(1)(b) or (c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s registration as a registered health worker would, but for this section, have expired before the appeal is determined.

subsection.leadIn: The registration remains in effect until—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Secretary determines the appeal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person withdraws the appeal.

section.name: s10B
section.heading: Registered health worker to report certain events

subsection.leadIn: A registered health worker must report to the Director if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prosecution is started against the health worker for an indictable offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the health worker is convicted of an indictable offence in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the health worker is sentenced to imprisonment (however described) in a place outside Hong Kong, whether or not the sentence is suspended; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: there is a change in the name or correspondence address of the health worker.

subsection.leadIn: The report must—

subparagraph.content: for an event described in subsection (1)(a), (b), (c) or (d)—as soon as reasonably practicable after the event occurs; or
for a change described in subsection (1)(e)—within 3 months after the change occurs; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

section.name: s10C
section.heading: Transitional provisions relating to registration before material date

subsection.content: Unless renewed under section 7A, a registration under section 6 that has effect immediately before the material date expires at midnight on the last day of the 5-year period beginning on the material date (expiry date).

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 7A(2)(a), an application for the renewal of the registration—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be made at any time on or after the material date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be made at least 6 months before the expiry date.

section.name: s10D
section.heading: Application for registration as registered health worker pending on material date
section.leadIn: If an application for registration under section 6—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was made before the material date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been determined by the Director before that date,

section.continued: this Part, as amended by the Residential Care Homes Legislation (Miscellaneous Amendments) Ordinance 2023 (12 of 2023), applies in relation to the application.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Staffing requirements

subsection.leadIn: The operator of a residential care home (other than a nursing home) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: employ a home manager for the residential care home; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that Schedule 1 is complied with in relation to the residential care home. (12 of 2023 s. 36)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: The operator of a nursing home must employ—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person as a home manager (who may also be the nurse-in-charge);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person (who is a registered nurse) as a nurse-in-charge; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a number of persons as care staff in the following way—

subparagraph.content: at least 1 registered nurse being on duty in the nursing home at any time;
at least 1 member of the care staff for every 3 (or less than 3) beds in the nursing home;
at least 1 nurse among every 3 (or less than 3) members of care staff in the nursing home. (34 of 2018 s. 147)

subsection.leadIn: An operator must not employ any person as— (12 of 2023 s. 36)

subparagraph.content: unless that person is a registered home manager or a registered home manager (provisional); and
subject to subsection (1A)(a), for any purpose other than employment as a home manager; (12 of 2023 s. 36)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an ancillary worker for any purpose other than employment as an ancillary worker;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a care worker for any purpose other than employment as a care worker;

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: unless that person is a registered health worker; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: for any purpose other than employment as a health worker; or

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: subject to subsection (1A)(a), for any purpose other than employment as a nurse.

subsection.content: The operator of a residential care home (other than a nursing home) must inform the Director, in writing within 14 days, of any change in the employment of a home manager under subsection (1)(a).
The operator of a nursing home must inform the Director, in writing within 14 days, of any change in the employment of a home manager or a nurse-in-charge under subsection (1A). (34 of 2018 s. 147)

section.name: s12
section.heading: Maintenance of records by operator
section.content: An operator shall maintain a record of the name, address and particulars of identity of every person employed in a residential care home.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Furnishing of plans by operator

subsection.content: The Director may by notice in writing served on an operator, require the operator to furnish him with a plan or diagram, with dimensions of the residential care home premises before the expiry of such time being not less than 14 days as shall be indicated in the notice.
An operator on whom a notice is served under subsection (1) shall, before the expiry of the time indicated in the notice, furnish the plan or diagram required by the Director.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Furnishing of details of fees by operator

subsection.content: The Director may by notice in writing served on an operator, require the operator to furnish him with details of any fees or charges payable by residents for the purposes of care at the residential care home, before the expiry of such time being not less than 14 days as shall be indicated in the notice.
An operator on whom a notice is served under subsection (1) shall, before the expiry of the time indicated in the notice, furnish the details of the fees and charges required by the Director.
An operator shall inform the Director, in writing within 14 days, of any change in the fees and charges so payable.

section.name: s14A
section.heading: Operator to ensure advertisement contains certain information

subsection.content: The operator of a residential care home must ensure that every advertisement published by or on behalf of the operator for promoting the residential care home contains information to the effect that a licence is in force in respect of the residential care home.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: publish (發布) includes issue, circulate, display, distribute and broadcast.

section.name: s14B
section.heading: Application of Part V
section.content: This Part applies to a person who is employed by the operator of a residential care home as a home manager of the residential care home in compliance with section 11(1)(a) or (1A)(a).

section.name: s15
section.heading: Submission of staff list by home manager

subsection.content: A home manager shall, if so required by the Director in writing, submit to the Director a list of staff employed by an operator under section 11, within 14 days of being so required.
A home manager shall at least once every 3 months inform the Director in writing of any change in the list of staff employed by an operator under section 11.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Maintenance of records by home manager
section.leadIn: A home manager must maintain a record of— (12 of 2023 s. 40)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name, address and particulars of identity of every resident;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the name, address and particulars of identity of at least 1 relative or 1 contact person of every resident;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: where or how any such relative or contact person may be contacted in an emergency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the date of admission and discharge of every resident;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any accident or illness suffered by a resident and of any remedial action taken in that behalf;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any death of a resident;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: any action taken, including the use of force or restraint, to prevent or restrain a resident from self-injury or injuring others, or damaging property, or creating a disturbance; (12 of 2023 s. 40)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: possessions or property stored or held on behalf of every resident;

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: any complaint made by a resident or any other person relating to the management or operation of the residential care home and any remedial action taken in that behalf.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Information to be given by home manager

subsection.content: The Director may, by notice in writing served on a home manager, require the home manager to provide such information concerning the residential care home as he may require before the expiry of such time being not less than 14 days as shall be indicated in the notice.
A home manager on whom a notice is served under subsection (1) shall, before the expiry of the time indicated in the notice, provide the information required by the Director.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Home manager to report scheduled infectious disease
section.content: If a home manager suspects or knows of a case of scheduled infectious disease amongst the residents or staff of a residential care home or suspects or knows that any such person has been in contact with a case of scheduled infectious disease, he shall immediately so report to the Director.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Location and Design of Residential Care Homes

section.name: s19
section.heading: Location
section.leadIn: No residential care home shall be situated in any part of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an industrial building; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: any premises the floor of which is immediately over the ceiling or immediately below the floor slab of any—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: godown;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: cinema;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: theatre; or

subparagraph.name: iv
subparagraph.content: premises wherein any trade which, in the opinion of the Director, may pose a risk to the life or safety of the residents is carried on.

section.name: s20
section.heading: Height

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), no part of a residential care home shall be situated at a height more than 24 m above the ground floor, measuring vertically from the ground of the building to the floor of the premises in which the residential care home is to be situated.

The Director may by notice in writing served on an operator authorize that any part of such residential care home may be situated at a height more than 24 m above the ground floor as may be indicated in the notice.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Design
section.leadIn: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be designed to suit the particular needs of residents as follows—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: every passage and doorway shall be wide enough to accommodate residents using walking aids or wheelchairs;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: non-slip tiles shall be fitted in every place where the safety of residents is in jeopardy by reason of a risk of slippage;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ceiling of every room shall, unless otherwise permitted by the Director, be situated at a height not less than 2.5 m measuring vertically from the floor or not less than 2.3 m measuring vertically from the floor to the underside of any beam.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Area of floor space per resident

subsection.leadIn: The minimum area of floor space required for each resident of a residential care home is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a nursing home or a care and attention home—9.5 m2; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an aged home or a self-care hostel—8 m2. (12 of 2023 s. 41)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a care and attention home to which this subsection applies, the minimum area of floor space required for each resident is—

subparagraph.content: during the 4-year period beginning on the material date—6.5 m2; and
during the 4-year period immediately after the period mentioned in subparagraph (i)—8 m2; or

paragraph.name: b

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1A) applies to a residential care home if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licence was in force in respect of the residential care home immediately before the material date; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licence is issued in respect of the residential care home on or after the material date on an application made before that date. (12 of 2023 s. 41)

subsection.content: In determining the area of floor space for the purposes of this section the area of any open space, podium, garden and any other area in the residential care home which the Director is satisfied is unsuitable for the purposes of a residential care home is to be disregarded. (12 of 2023 s. 41)

section.name: s23
section.heading: Accessibility
section.content: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be accessible by emergency services.

section.name: s24
section.heading: Heating, lighting and ventilation
section.content: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be adequately heated, lighted and ventilated.

section.name: s25
section.heading: Toilet facilities

subsection.content: Every residential care home shall be provided with toilet facilities and sanitary arrangements of a type approved by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: Every room used for toilet facilities shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to the satisfaction of the Director, be provided with fittings appropriate to the use of the toilet facilities by residents;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at all times be kept in a clean and sanitary condition;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not be used for any other purpose.

section.name: s26
section.heading: Water supply and ablutions
section.leadIn: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be provided with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an adequate and wholesome supply of water;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequate washing and laundering facilities;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: adequate bathing facilities.

section.name: s27
section.heading: Repair
section.content: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be kept in a state of good repair.

section.name: s28
section.heading: Precautions for health and safety
section.content: In every residential care home the design, the construction (including the fire resistance of the elements of construction) and the properties of the materials must be such that the health and safety of the residents, and in particular their safe escape in the event of fire, are, to the satisfaction of the Director, reasonably assured.

section.name: s29
section.heading: Fire prevention equipment
section.content: Every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director of Fire Services, be provided with adequate apparatus and equipment required as a safeguard against fire.

section.name: s30
section.heading: Fire exits
section.leadIn: The fire exits and exit routes of every residential care home shall, to the satisfaction of the Director, be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: kept free from obstruction; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: adequately illuminated.

section.name: s31
section.heading: Inspection of premises by members of Fire Services Department

subsection.leadIn: Any member of the Fire Services Department may, without warrant and on production if so required, of proof of his membership and of his particulars of identity, at all reasonable times enter and inspect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any residential care home; or

paragraph.name: b

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: building or part of any building where a residential care home is situated; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: building, place or premises adjacent or near to a residential care home,

paragraph.continued: if it appears to such member that a risk of fire to the residential care home may arise in such other building, part of any building, place or premises.

subsection.content: No person shall obstruct a member of the Fire Services Department in the exercise of his powers under subsection (1).

section.name: s32
section.heading: Report from Fire Services Department
section.content: Any member of the Fire Services Department may, in relation to any residential care home, report to the Director any matter arising from an inspection under section 31 or relating to the protection of life or property under the Fire Services Ordinance (Cap. 95) and may make recommendations to the Director as to anything necessary to preclude danger from fire.

section.name: s33
section.heading: Storage and administration of medicine

subsection.content: All medicine kept in a residential care home must, to the satisfaction of the Director, be kept in a secure and locked place.

A medicine that is prescribed by a registered medical practitioner, a registered Chinese medicine practitioner or a listed Chinese medicine practitioner for a resident in a residential care home may only be administered to the resident in accordance with the prescription.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: registered Chinese medicine practitioner (註冊中醫) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Chinese Medicine Ordinance (Cap. 549).

section.name: s33A
section.heading: Use of restraints

subsection.leadIn: A restraint must not be used on a resident in a residential care home unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the safety, health or well-being of the resident or other persons is endangered;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no other less restrictive means to avoid the danger are available in the circumstances; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the requirements relating to obtaining consent to the use of restraint as set out in the Codes of Practice issued under section 22 of the Ordinance are complied with.

subsection.leadIn: A restraint may only be used—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the safe and proper manner as set out in the Codes of Practice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for no longer than is necessary.

subsection.content: The use of a restraint must be closely monitored and reviewed to ensure that subsections (1) and (2) are complied with in relation to the continued use of the restraint.

section.name: s33B
section.heading: Protection of residents’ dignity and privacy when providing care etc.
section.content: When a personal care service is provided to, or a nursing care procedure is performed on, a resident in a residential care home, adequate facilities or measures must be provided or taken, to the satisfaction of the Director, to avoid improper exposure of body parts and protect the dignity and privacy of the resident.

section.name: s34
section.heading: Medical examination of residents

subsection.content: The operator of a residential care home must ensure that each resident is medically examined at least once in every 12 months.
The examination must be conducted by a registered medical practitioner, who must report in writing to the operator on the health of each resident.
A copy of such report must be kept by the operator and made available at all reasonable times for inspection by the Director or any inspector.

section.name: s35
section.heading: Discharge of resident by operator
section.content: An operator may, by notice in writing served on any resident and on a relative or contact person of such resident, discharge that resident and require him to quit the residential care home before the expiry of such period being not less than 30 days as shall be indicated in the notice.

section.name: s36
section.heading: Offences by operators and home managers

subsection.content: An operator who fails to comply with section 11, 12, 13(2), 14(2) or (3) or 14A(1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.
A home manager who fails to comply with section 15, 16, 17(2) or 18 commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s37
section.heading: Offence of obstruction
section.content: Any person who contravenes section 31(2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s38
section.heading: Fees
section.content: A fee specified in column 3 of Schedule 3 is payable to the Director for the matter described, opposite the fee, in column 2 of that Schedule.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 1
section.def: specified period (指明期間), in relation to a day, means the period from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. on that day;
staff member (員工) means a home manager, a nurse, a health worker, a care worker or an ancillary worker.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Number of residents to be rounded up to next multiple
section.leadIn: If, in relation to a residential care home (other than a nursing home)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the number of residents of the residential care home is not a multiple of the specified number,

section.continued: then, for the purpose of determining the number of staff members required, the number of residents of the residential care home is to be rounded up to the next multiple of the specified number.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Care and attention home
section.leadIn: For a care and attention home, during or at the time specified in column 2 of Table 1 on every day, there must be at least the number of staff members that is specified in column 3 of Table 1 opposite the time.

td.p: 1 health worker (on-site and on duty) for every 30 residents, and for this purpose, 1 nurse (on-site and on duty) is considered equivalent to 2 health workers (on-site and on duty)
1 care worker (on duty) for every 20 residents
Any time other than the 10 hours mentioned in item 2
1 care worker (on duty) for every 40 residents
1 ancillary worker (on duty) for every 40 residents
From 6 p.m. on a day to 7 a.m. on the next day
2 staff members (on duty) (who may be persons engaged for complying with a requirement specified in any other item of this Table)
Any time when a resident is in the care and attention home
1 staff member (on-site and on duty) (who may be a person engaged for complying with a requirement specified in any other item of this Table)

section.name: s4
section.heading: Aged home
section.leadIn: For an aged home, during or at the time specified in column 2 of Table 2 on every day, there must be at least the number of staff members that is specified in column 3 of Table 2 opposite the time.

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 nurse (on-site and on duty); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 health worker (on-site and on duty) for every 60 residents

td.p: 1 care worker (on duty) or ancillary worker (on duty) for every 30 residents
From 6 p.m. on a day to 7 a.m. on the next day
2 staff members (on duty) (who may be persons engaged for complying with a requirement specified in any other item of this Table)
Any time when a resident is in the aged home
1 staff member (on-site and on duty) (who may be a person engaged for complying with a requirement specified in any other item of this Table)

section.name: s5
section.heading: Self-care hostel
section.leadIn: For a self-care hostel, during or at the time specified in column 2 of Table 3 on every day, there must be at least the number of staff members that is specified in column 3 of Table 3 opposite the time.

td.p: 1 care worker (on duty) or ancillary worker (on duty) for every 60 residents
Any time between 7 a.m. and 6 p.m. when a resident is in the self-care hostel
1 staff member (on-site and on duty) (who may be a person engaged for complying with the requirement specified in item 1)
From 6 p.m. on a day to 7 a.m. on the next day
Both of the following staff members (who may be persons engaged for complying with the requirement specified in item 1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: 1 staff member on-site (whether or not on duty);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: 1 staff member on call (whether or not on-site)

section.name: s6
section.heading: Certain staffing requirements must be complied with during specific hours approved by Director

subsection.content: If, in relation to a residential care home (other than a nursing home), this Schedule requires at least a certain number of staff members during a certain number of hours within the specified period on every day (requirement), the requirement must be complied with during a specific period of, or specific periods totalling, that number of hours (specific hours) on every day as approved by the Director under this section in relation to the residential care home.

subsection.leadIn: For the requirement, the operator of the residential care home—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must apply to the Director for approval of the specific hours proposed by the operator; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may propose in the application different specific hours for different days.

subsection.leadIn: The application must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in the form and manner specified by the Director; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: contain the information specified by the Director.

subsection.leadIn: The Director may approve the specific hours proposed by the operator if satisfied that the proposal is appropriate having regard to all relevant circumstances, including—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the schedule of activities of the residents of the residential care home; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the rest hours of the residents of the residential care home.

td.p: Registration as a registered home manager under section 3A
Renewal of a registration as a registered home manager under section 3E
Registration as a registered home manager (provisional) under section 3M
Registration as a registered health worker under section 6
Renewal of a registration as a registered health worker under section 7A
